  • Constructor Details

    • Battleship

      public Battleship(Socket client)
      Constructs a Battleship game instance with an initial player connected.
      Parameters:
      client - The socket representing the connection of the initial player.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Runs the main logic of the Battleship game, including player connection checks, map selection, player readiness checks, game execution, winner determination, and game closure. Overrides the run method of the Runnable interface.
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • printWinner

      private void printWinner(int loserIndex)
      Prints winner and loser messages to the players.
      Parameters:
      loserIndex - The index of the losing player in the 'players' list.

    • getOtherPlayer

      public Optional<Battleship.PlayerHandler> getOtherPlayer(Battleship.PlayerHandler playerHandler)
      Retrieves the other player (not equal to the given player) from the 'players' list.
      Parameters:
      playerHandler - The player for which to find the other player.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the other player, or empty if not found.

    • playGame

      private int playGame()
      Plays the main game loop, taking turns between players until the game is over.
      Returns:
      The index of the losing player in the 'players' list.

    • checkForDisconnect

      private void checkForDisconnect() throws PlayerNotFoundException
      Throws:
      PlayerNotFoundException

    • swapPlayer

      private int swapPlayer(int playerIndex)
      Swaps the player index to toggle between players in a two-player game.
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - The current player index.
      Returns:
      The index of the other player.

    • checkPlayersReady

      private void checkPlayersReady()
      Waits until all players are ready by continuously checking their readiness. The method sleeps for a short duration between checks to avoid excessive CPU usage. If any player is not ready, it keeps waiting until all players are ready.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If an InterruptedException occurs during the waiting process.

    • mapSelection

      private void mapSelection()
      Waits until two map choices are available and assigns the chosen maps to the players. Checks continuously for player readiness at a short interval.

    • checkPlayersConnected

      private void checkPlayersConnected()
      Waits until the required number of players are connected before starting the game. Checks continuously for player connection at a short interval.

    • sendMapMessage

      private void sendMapMessage(int rand)
      Sends messages related to map selection to both players.
      Parameters:
      rand - The index used to select a map from the choices.

    • broadCast

      private void broadCast(String sameChoice)
      Sends the same message to both players in the game.
      Parameters:
      sameChoice - The message to be broadcasted to both players.

    • submitMapChoice

      public void submitMapChoice(MapType type)
      Submits a chosen map type to the list of available choices.
      Parameters:
      type - The chosen map type to be added to the list of choices.

    • gameNotOver

      private boolean gameNotOver()
      Checks if the game is not over by verifying if any player still has active ships.
      Returns:
      True if the game is not over (at least one player has active ships), false otherwise.

    • updateMaps

      private void updateMaps()
      Updates the maps for all players by sending the current state of their maps to each player.

    • checkPlayersNotReady

      private boolean checkPlayersNotReady()
      Checks if any player is not ready to proceed with the game.
      Returns:
      True if at least one player is not ready, false otherwise.

    • checkPlayersNotConnected

      private boolean checkPlayersNotConnected()
      Checks if the required number of players is not connected to the game.
      Returns:
      True if the number of connected players is not equal to the required number, false otherwise.

    • acceptPlayer

      public void acceptPlayer(Socket client)
      Accepts a new player by adding a player handler for the given socket to the game. Marks the game as closed to new players after accepting the first player. Submits each player handler to the executor service for concurrent processing.
      Parameters:
      client - The socket representing the connection to the new player.

    • closeGame

      public void closeGame()
      Closes the Battleship game by setting the 'finished' flag to true and closing the connections for all connected players.

    • isOpen

      public boolean isOpen()
      Checks if the game is open for accepting new players.
      Returns:
      True if the game is open, allowing new players to join; false otherwise.

    • isFinished

      public boolean isFinished()
      Checks whether the game has finished.
      Returns:
      True if the game has finished, false otherwise.
